name: Walnut-Pumpkin Cookies
author: Dawn Hillier
summary: These pumpkin cookies are frosted with maple frosting. There has never been a person who has not LOVED these cookies, even those who do not like pumpkin cookies. It has been a family recipe for 35 years. It has won 1st prize at a cookie exchange and at a pumpkin contest at work. I usually triple the recipe!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon maple extract, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix sugar and shortening together in a bowl
Add pumpkin and vanilla extract; mix well
Add flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt and mix until well combined
Use small teaspoons or a cookie scoop to drop rounded teaspoonfuls of cookie dough onto ungreased baking sheets
Bake in the preheated oven until edges turn golden, 10 to 12 minutes
Meanwhile, beat powdered sugar and butter together with an electric mixer until combined
Stir in milk, 1 teaspoon at a time, until a frosting consistency is reached
Fold in maple extract until thoroughly combined
Spread maple frosting over the cooled cookies
